intro: Amsinckia appressa, commonly known as the sticky evening-primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and sticky, glandular hairs on its stems and leaves. The plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Amsinckia appressa is a member of the evening-primrose family (Onagraceae) and is known for its ecological importance as a food source for various insects and pollinators.
